alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 09 at 8:56PM PST until February 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...LONG PERIOD NORTHWEST SWELL WILL BRING RISK OF SNEAKER WAVES TO BEACHES EARLY THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... .A long period northwest swell with period 16 to 18 seconds is forecast to start impacting the coastal waters early Thursday morning. This enhanced wave energy will increase the risk of sneaker waves and rip currents. With warm weather in the forecast, beachgoers need to be aware of these threats. A beach hazard statement for sneaker waves is issued when the ocean state features a deceptively calm ocean with long lulls between large waves capable of knocking unsuspecting beachgoers off of coastal rocks, jetties, and outcroppings into the cold, restless ocean. ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM PST THURSDAY THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Northwest swell of 6 to 8 feet at 16 to 18 seconds expected. * WHERE...San Francisco, Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, San Francisco Peninsula Coast, Northern Monterey Bay and Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast. * WHEN...From early Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Risk of sneaker waves and strong rip currents. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Long lulls are typical between hazardous sneakers waves and the ocean may appear relatively calm for up to 30 minutes between larger waves.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Northern Monterey Bay; San Francisco; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
